pages.text: Affected by the power of EMCWorld, the raiding villagers here become extremely aggressive and arrogant. $(br2) In their eyes, they only want to attack $(c) players with a profession level of at least 80 and second class who are in a village, and they are unwilling to launch raids in $(c) dimensions other than the Overworld $().

Raiding villagers think that only valuable villages are suitable for attack. When the player dies, the village will be completely looted, which also means $(c) raid failure $(). $(br2)Affected by the power of EMCWorld, the maximum number of waves of raiding will be increased to $(c) 20 $() waves (depending on the difficulty), and the raiding villagers will become more aggressive. $(br2)When the raid begins, the raiding villagers will attack from $(c) any position in the village $(), and all raiding villagers will attack in a dispersed manner. They will precisely calculate and attack according to the $(2) arithmetic mean coordinates of the villager and player positions.

The raiding villagers have mastered the core of EMCWorld, so during the raid, all block entities will $(c) stop working $(). At the same time, they $(c) will not $() be affected by falling, explosions, or friendly fire. $(br2)The villagers have suppressed the power of EMCWorld, so when there are too few villagers, the player will receive additional $(2) damage bonus $(). $(br2)These raiders will drop unique pieces of Raid Fragment (only on 3.0 difficulty), which have great effects and are extremely rare.
